definitions.definition: a small part of something that has broken off or comes from something larger

examples.text: Police found fragments of glass near the scene.
The shattered vase lay in fragments on the floor.

definitions.definition: a single part of something; a part that is not complete

examples.text: I overheard a fragment of their conversation.
She could recall only fragments of his poetry.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from French, or from Latin fragmentum, from frangere ‘to break’.
